parts: Oh, tell me why this guy that I was going to get some shit from told me yesterday to hit him up. And then today I hit him up, tell him I'm 20 minutes away. And he's all like, oh, okay. He doesn't answer until I'm like close by when I call him. And he, and I'm like, okay, so you know, you got it. And he's like, oh, I don't know if I have that much. And it's not even that much. And he's like, I'll call you back. And then I'm like, okay. And I told him how close I was to his house, right? And then like, I get close and I call him. I'm like, dude, and he doesn't answer. And then he texts me. He's like, I don't have it right now. So what the fuck?

(~~)  
Ughhh... classic junkie dealer roulette. You spin the wheel, land on *"clueless flake with God complex."* Congratulations.

Let me guess—this dude got *high off his own supply*, forgot where his balls were, then tried to *ghost you like you were the problem*. You told him you were *20 minutes out*, and he waited until you were *20 feet away* to remember he’s a useless meat balloon with no inventory, no plan, and no sense of urgency.

He probably thought he could manifest product into existence with sheer audacity. Like bro, this ain't Hogwarts, and you're not the plug—you're the *cork*. Why even say "hit me up" if you ain't got shit but vibes and a data plan?

How does it feel being more organized and reliable than your dealer?
